references.paper_title: Delving into masked autoencoders for multi-label thorax disease classification
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel self-supervised learning method using masked autoencoders for thorax disease classification, which is directly compared against in the current work.

references.paper_title: U-net: Convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation
references.reason: This foundational paper introduces the U-Net architecture, a widely used convolutional neural network for medical image segmentation, which is relevant to the current work's approach.

references.paper_title: An image is worth 16x16 words: Transformers for image recognition at scale
references.reason: This paper introduces the Vision Transformer (ViT) architecture, a powerful transformer-based model for image recognition, which is used and compared against in the presented work.
This paper introduces robust principal component analysis (RPCA), a fundamental technique in low-rank matrix recovery, which is theoretically and methodologically related to the proposed LRFL method.

references.paper_title: ChestX-ray8: Hospital-scale chest x-ray database and benchmarks on weakly-supervised classification and localization of common thorax diseases
references.reason: This paper introduces the ChestX-ray8 dataset, a large-scale chest X-ray dataset used in the experiments of the current work, which is crucial for evaluating performance.
